1326$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$5/3/2010 9:23:15 PM$Reviewer: John
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was prescribed this medication by my doctor after being diagnosed with General Anxiety Disorder six months ago. Lexapro has completly changed my life for the good!

column1: I take 10mg each day. Upon starting the medication
column2: I did vomit the first day and then felt nauseous each morning for about the first week. After that all nausea feelings went away.

column1: The 2 major side effects that I suffer most from with this medication are increased persperation and problems ejaculating. I sometimes have twitches
column2: but usually right after I wake up. Sometimes concentrating is hard
column3: especially when multi-tasking. Occasionally
column4: I experience forgetfullness like walking into a room to get something and not remembering what it was when I get there.

column1: I have not experienced any issues with weiht gain
column2: regular nausea
column3: or night sweats. I actually feel that I get a better nights sleep since I have been using Lexapro. As mentioned
column4: my persperation level has increased especially when I am active. (sports
column5: exercising
column6: etc.). Ejaculation has been prolonged and sometimes never
column7: since I have started usage.

column1: It does not seem that alcohol consumption  intensifies the effect
column2: but I only drink socially.

column1: My doctor said this would be the best medication for a person in my age group with the least amount of side effects and referred to it as a ""chill pill"". Things that use to irritate me
column2: seem to not bother me at all now. It just rolls right down my back.

column1: Prior to taking my first dose I read the reviews here on Web Md
column2: and was a little hesitant and even scared about taking it. After the nausea and sick feeling I wanted to stop after the first few days and stuck it out. Give it time to get into your system and start working. It only took a week for me. Everyone around me that knows I take it can see a differnce in my personality. I went for about 3 years before I spoke with my doctor about anxiety issues. I could not imagine living like I previously did. Lexapro is the best!!! Highly recommend!"

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"Lexapro has drastically changed my everyday interactions and mood.  I used to go to a ""dark place"" very frequently during my adult life.  Whenever I was happy
column3: I was the life of the party.  I could always be social and entertaining if alcohol was used.  Now I can have fun without it.  My days are so much more under control. My marriage was threatened because of my unpredictable behaviors.  I would be gleeful one day
column4: and overspend
column5: then be withdrawn and silent for the next week.  I really believe that there is a chemical reason for the behaviors that lexapro controls.  The only negative is that since I have been taking the drug
column6: I have been drinking beer more heavily than ever--almost daily.  Once I get started I cannot stop until bedtime.  I have a bit of a sexual dysfunction as well.  Sometimes it is difficult to maintain an erection.  I'm not sure if it is from the medication or the drinking.  I wonder if the medication enhances the addictive behavior regarding the alcohol
column7: and if so
column8: would another SSRI possibly work as well with less side effects?  I know I should talk to my physician about this
column9: but I am ashamed to talk about the addiction. Even so
column10: my days are so much better
column11: I feel contented. Little things that used to bother me
column12: just don't now.  It's funny
column13: but if I forget to take the lexapro
column14: I can really feel a difference in my mood and interactions with others.  "

1351$Condition: Depression$4/14/2010 2:45:39 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$I havent been on this med in 2 years
column2: and i only took it for about a week (i was prescribed it at the hospital right after I had my son for post partium depression). Anyways
column3: they started me out taking 1/2
column4: once everyother day for 4 days
column5: then take 1 a day (to build it up in my system). Well
column6: two days after i started taking a whole pill
column7: i guess it built up enough in my system because i had a MAJOR reaction to it. My husband thought that i was high or something (and i felt it)
column8: i couldn't take care of my week old son
column9: i felt terrible and just wanted to die. We couldn't figure out what was wrong with me
column10: but luckily my mother-in-law was also on it and had kept the paper explaining the effects of an allergic reaction. I was shaking uncontrolably
column11: felt as though i couldn't breath
column12: wasn't able to hold myself up
column13: it was bad. Anyways
column14: my hasband took me to the hospital
column15: they left me in the waiting room for 2 hours and i just got worse. We ended up leaving to go to another hospital
column16: and on the way drop our son of to his sister. She called the ambulance to meet us at her house
column17: and when we pulled up
column18: i got out of the car and ended up falling on the ground (basically blacked out). The ambulance showed up right after and put me in and gave me that epie pen shot. It helped instantly. Anyways
column19: i'm not writing this to say that it's a bad med (it worked wonders for my mother-in-law)
column20: I'm just writing this to warn people to watch out for a reaction and to get to the hospital immediatally if you feel off like that. I hope no one has to go thru that pain
column21: but i do know that it happens
column22: so be careful. I hope this helps at least one person.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have suffered with social anxiety since I was 12 years old over 22 years of my life. column6: but exhausted feeling.

column1: I went off the Lexapro and it took nearly a year for my sex drive to return and it has returned
column2: but not to what it was before I took it. I still have not been able to lose the weight even though I exercise an hour a day and jog 5 miles a day. column3: then one every few days then one a week and then none. I could not even tell a difference at all.

column1: I am on no medication now. I had gone on the generic brand of Wellbutrin and that was a horror story. Worse drug ever. So I am winging it alone now and doing fine. I do keep Xanax on hand in case of emergencies
column2: but so far so good.

column1: All in all
column2: Lexapro is probably a good drug for a lot of people
column3: just be aware that you may gain weight

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have had wonderful results from this medication (10 mg).  I have been on it for 3 years due to anxiety disorder.  I didn't gain any weight from it and I went off of it with no side effects when I got pregnant.  I used to have a nervous tick in my right eye when I spoke to people I didn't know.  That was gone within a month. I don't get antsy and fidgety anymore and I can relax in a crowd. My subconscious yelling at me for what I did 10 years ago finally subsided. I was borderline anti-social.  I love this medication it has change my life for the best and I don't ever plan on going off of it unless my insurance makes me. My insurance would not cover this drug for about 6 months and I went off and changed to Zoloft and another drug that were totally ineffective. That time I had no real side effects either that I could blame on Lexapro.

column1: 1534$Condition: Bipolar Depression$1/25/2010 2:59:21 AM$Reviewer: Vicki
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$3$4$"I have been on Lexapro for about 8 years now. I have what has only recently been categorized as Bipolar Depression. I am bipolar but my main symptoms are depression. I have brief bouts of mania but overall am mostly depressed. This medicine works rather well for the depression; however
column3: my mania/rage is not very well contained. I have made diet/behavoiral/lifestyle changes to compensate for this and my life is now pretty well balanced. It does take some time before you are adjusted and see satisfactory results(6 months-1 year). After so many years on it
column4: I am noticing that I have gotten ""ditzy"" and forgetful
column5: but that is still better than constant suicide attempts and crying nonstop. I was an extremely detailed and almost ocd person before and now my standards of organization and scheduling are more lax. Still
column6: better than the alternatives..."

column1: 1535$"Condition: ""Change of Life"" Signs"$1/24/2010 12:40:55 PM$Reviewer: HotFlashMama
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I started taking this medication for hot flashes at the suggestion of my Family Medicine doctor.  He works with a doctor who treats women for breast cancer and she says the first thing patients do when they come into her office is to throw away their Premarin or any and all female hormones and start on Lexapro for their menopausal symptoms.  She says
column3: ""female hormomes cause breast cancer"".  I tried 10 mg first and felt this was too much.  My doctor said
column4: ""half it"" so I did and I am one happy camper.  I was flashing all day long before.   I mentioned this to my OB/GYN doc the other day and I could tell he thinks this is for depression but when I tried to explain
column5: he cut me off.  So sad for those taking cancer causing female hormones because this is the greatest remedy for hot flashes that ever came down the pike!  Spread the word
column6: save your girlfriends!"

column1: 1536$Condition: Depression$1/24/2010 9:42:25 AM$Reviewer: Maria
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I started Lexipro at 10 mg few weeks ago. The first week  I had pretty severe headaches
column3: trouble sleeping
column4: dry mouth and a 'loopy' feeling. A colleague of mine
column5: who was also on this medication
column6: told me to hang in. I listened and am now feeling  great. Lexipro has  taken the edge off. It has not changed my basic personality but I feel better able to cope and deal with tough situations. I have a significant family history of depression. My father committed suicide and my grandfather suffered from what they called back in the day a nervous breakdown. I was resistant in the past to taking medication but when I was hit recently with depression where all I wanted to do was sleep and had to drag myself to work
column7: I knew I couldn't just snap out of it. So far so good.

column1: 1551$Condition: Panic Disorder$1/19/2010 4:16:45 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I am 25 & have had bad panic attacks & anxiety my whole life. Recently I have had a string of really stressful situations come up and anxiety
column2: panic
column3: & depression combined with OCD & ADD & really bad mood swings (screaming
column4: breaking & throwing anything I could get my hands on).  I was ready for something! I didn't feel like I needed to see a therapist
column5: I kinda know whats wrong with me
column6: so I saw a doctor that deals with depression & ADD/OCD. I just wanted try something! She explained that while medicine doesn't change who you are it changes how you react to things. I am on Lexapro 20 mg and the only side effect seems to be I wake up in the middle of the night dripping in sweat! I am generally happier
column7: calmer
column8: relaxed
column9: donn't let the small things bother me. I have had a few bouts of depression here and there but it goes away & its nothing I'd consider abnormal. I can finally & my OCD is alot calmer. My advice to anyone just starting on it is the first week
column10: you feel like your flying! I loved it
column11: but some may have a stronger reaction
column12: just give it some time and it should level out.

column1: 1552$Condition: Depression$1/18/2010 4:38:19 PM$Reviewer: beans
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$2$"Lexapro really was almost like a miracle pill for me. I was given a 4 week supply sample originally to help me with a sleeping problem (as the doctor had asked if i also felt anxiety or depression). In that time
column3: my depression had diminished (and i had EXTREMELY difficult family situations that started 2 weeks after i took it...great timing...I would have been completely depressed and beside myself
column4: but I felt great.)

column1: I was diagnosed with metabolic syndrome (high blood pressure
column2: overweight/obesity
column3: cholesterol issues) a few months earlier. Lexapro lowered my high blood pressure to a perfect score
column4: acted as an appetite suppressant
column5: and i lost weight because of it.

column1: obviously this wont be the case with everyone. the only side effects i experienced were moderate nausea and occasional headaches when first incorporating the drug into my system (first week or two).

I've had varying levels of depression since i was 13. I'm now going on 22 so i still have a while to go. i was off it for 2 months and i just bought my first prescription for it. 2nd day: nausea and headache. hopefully it will just go away like it did before."

column6: and I have orgasms all the time! I want everyone to know to talk to your doctor about taking Lexapro at night!! The side effects are non-existent! It saved my life

column1: I find that lexapro works better for me when I take it around the same time every day after I've eaten usually around 9:30am after breakfast. Lexapro will make you nauseated if you do not eat before taking. But as for not sleeping or gaining weight as mentioned in other reviews I have actually lost weight because I do more in the day
column2: I don't go home and just sit on the couch any more after work. This is the benefit of taking this medicine early in the morning I accomplish more during the day and when I go to bed I'm naturally tired and fall asleep. I don't plan on being on this medicine for very long but it is working for me when I'm needing it the most."

1643$Condition: Depression$12/10/2009 10:37:03 PM$Reviewer: CLL, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$This website has been SO valuable during my frustration with different medications. You need to read over ALL the reviews and rule out a few that don't seem to jive with all the others.  There's always a few out there who are dissatisfied. That doesn't mean those same things will happen to you.  Do your research and remember
column2: everyone is different and react to drugs differently.

column1: Don't be scared the first time you see a reviewer mention weight gain or decreased libido.  It's more important that you get to feeling better and you can deal with those things later.
I've had depression for 30 years and Prozac 20mg worked for me up until I hit 50. Perhaps it was because I'm pre-menopausal or because I'd taken the same drug
column2: at the same dose for so many years.  I went to the doctor and tried several other drugs. At first
column3: I wasn't satisfied with any of them
column4: so I got on Effexor XR.  Wow!  Please read about the withdrawl symptoms when going off of Effexor
column5: because they are severe. Try all the other meds first. Something will work for you.

column1: Bottom line
column2: I'm going back on Lexapro.  I don't think I gave it enough of a chance and it was working pretty well for me. Be patient and don't try to change meds or get off of something without a doctor's advice.  Been there
column3: done that
column4: and it was terrible.  I believe that Lexapro is a wonderful drug. It is sure the best I've tried so far. I believe our bodies get used to something and it finally stops working. That's what happened to me with Prozac
column5: although it was my wonder drug for 20+ years. I'm going to ask my doctor if perhaps I should rotate between Lexapro and Prozac every few years. That may be the answer for me.

column1: DON'T GIVE UP. Antidepressants will help you get your life back
column2: but you have to be patient. Also exercise
column3: eat right
column4: and talk to someone who cares. God bless you all and best wishes in your recovery.

column1: There is light at the end of the tunnel
column2: I promise.

column1: 1667$Condition: Obsessive Compulsive Disorder$12/2/2009 1:15:20 AM$Reviewer: lex me up
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$4$5$No weight gain/ panic.  Life is manageable.  I got a little nauseous as I increased the dosage.  I'm now taking 40mg in the morning and have been on this dosage for about 3 months.  Sexual sides lasted a few weeks.  Now sex is even better than before.  Complete control.  The reason I only gave it a 3 in effectiveness is that I still have intrusive thoughts that can bother me sometimes for a few days
column3: before it was weeks.  I was able to quit checking my car/apt/and hand washing most of the time.  and i rarely apologize unless I am truely wrong. I still battle with fear of obsessing about a bad obsession.  lol.  but its never really that bad!!  The spike doesn't make me miserable.  Some of the other SSRI's gave me a burning sensation in my body/neck/shoulder. Lexapro gave me a milder burning sensation for the first week at 5mg.  I took it at night to cope.  After it got in my system the burning sensation went away.  This took about a week and was well worth it.  I feel it is a much cleaner SSRI.  I do eat healthy and work out a few times a week.  I also do CBT with my shrink every few weeks.  I was literally living in fear 80 percent of the day before Lexapro. Now i would say its around 20-30 percent.  I can concentrate and enjoy relationships again.  Sleep is better too!  I do find it makes me a little tired some days and manic others
column4: but nothing extreme. Give lex a try if you are sensitive to other SSRI's.

column1: 1670$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$12/1/2009 3:03:21 PM$Reviewer: AnxiousNurse
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"When I first started taking this med I didn't know if I could tolerate it.  I was VERY anxious for the first few weeks
column3: probably more so than why I even got on it.  My pdoc wanted me to take ativan 2-3 times daily to get thru the early period of adjusting to this med
column4: and I am really glad I weathered the storm.  I am more level headed
column5: can handle the day-to-day more easily
column6: do not jump the gun and start yelling at people for no reason
column7: and no longer suffer from random anxiety attacks on a daily basis.  My PMS is almost non-existent
column8: whereas before my husband would take cover for 7-10 days before my period.  I truly would have headed for the hills far away from this med had my doctor not warned me about the start-up side effects.  Some people may not have them
column9: but if you are like me and notice EVERY LITTLE THING that changes in you body and mind
column10: you may be more sensitive to these types of meds and it may just freak you out.  Nothing a little scheduled ativan can't handle.  Thankfully my doc trusted me to take this
column11: as I know other docs won't prescribe it for their patients.  I don't know how else I would have made it through the first 2-3 weeks.  Now I almost never have to take the ativan
column12: because when I do get anxiety it is mild and I can talk myself off the edge of insanity pretty easily unlike before when I would just freak out immediately.  I do have a decreased libido but Lexapro comes with a built-in ""I don't give a crap"" mentality for so many things
column13: including your reaction to the minor side effects you may have to live with.  And it's not ""I don't care I'm a zombie"" it's ""I'm not going to take that too seriously"".  BTW I only take 7.5 mg because 10 mg made my muscles twitch for some reason
column14: but it seems to still work great.  Good luck!"

column1: 1717$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$11/12/2009 10:12:46 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$It's amazing. I never wanted to be one of those 'statistics'. I didnt want to be on medication every day. But i also couldnt live with the constant (what I call) heart dropping feeling. It was taking over my life. The first few weeks def. took some getting used to. But after being on Lexapro for over 4 months I feel like my old self (which has been soo long since i've seen).
1718$Condition: Panic Disorder$11/11/2009 12:51:48 AM$Reviewer: Don
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$My relationship with Lexapro lasted one day. The side effects were so extreme I couldn't even make it in to work today. How odd I've been counting down the minutes until the Lexapro gets out of my system and I can go back to my old
column3: normal nervous wreck. Took dose one last night with dinner. Within an hour felt drugged and nauseous. Fell into a coma-like sleep for about 4 hours and woke up around 7am. Layed in bed in a for a while before I realized the side effects. Heart racing in my chest like it was about to burst
column4: hot and sweaty. Got up out of bed to test the waters and the dizzyness and trembling hands began to set in. Basically it took my anxiety attacks
column5: turned them up to full volume and added a myriad of other side effects. And I could feel the numb
column6: zombielike state blanketing it all. No thanks. This drug made me realize I need to master this disorder through more natural methods. Today scared the shit out of me. I assume a lot of people posting here are young and in school by saying they sleep all day or take 3 naps a day. I have to work full time and couldn't do it taking this drug judging how I felt today.

column1: 1719$Condition: Depression$11/10/2009 1:41:08 AM$Reviewer: snc860
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$I've never taken anything for depression before and after only one dose
column3: I felt very hyper all day long and then I was very restless at nighttime and it felt like all my thoughts at once were becoming visual and vivid
column4: like something in a Kaleidoscope.  I have trouble sleeping anyway and so this isn't helping me at all.  I woke up very confused after sleeping only about an hour.  Not very happy with this medication at all.  Will be talking to my doctor in the morning.

column1: 1720$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$11/9/2009 5:05:55 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$4$"When I started taking Lexipro
column2: it was like night and day.  I was diagnosed with MDD when I was 10
column3: and have struggled to find treatment that would work ever since.  The first day I took Lexipro
column4: I felt like getting out and socalizing
column5: something that has never happened to me before.  People around me noticed a difference (my grandpa commented that I had more sparkle).  The downside is if I don't take my pill at the same time every day
column6: I get diarrhea.  I also have trouble sleeping
column7: and as a result am tired all the time. Lexipro also does not manage my anxiety as well as my previous medication
column8: and I have had a sharp increase in panic attacks.

column1: Overall
column2: though
column3: Lexipro does such a good job managing my mood
column4: I'm willing to over-look the side effects (which do seem to be getting better as time goes on.)"

column1: 1721$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$11/9/2009 2:39:22 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Let me first say that for the first 2 weeks
column2: I wanted OFF this
column3: but after a lifetime of no med working 4 my depression/anxiety
column4: I'm SO glad I didn't! I haven't been able to work out of the home for the last 3 years because of my depression/anxiety/add/pmdd) so was able to take the time to adjust. The 1st couple of days I thought I was losing my mind. I'd be crying for ten minutes
column5: then extremely agitated for ten
column6: then ok for ten - press repeat.  Essentially
column7: 1st two weeks didn't feel at all like myself & had severe nausea
column8: sleep problems
column9: you name it including suicidal thoughts (try not to be alone
column10: although I had to). But after having tried no kidding EVERY other drug out there just about with no luck
column11: I was desperate & hung in there
column12: just hoping. 2-3 months into taking 10mg I WAS noticing some improvement but not enough with my anxiety
column13: so my doctor upped me to 20mg. So I had a repeat of the two weeks of hell - after a couple of weeks it was bearable but still wasn't myself for a couple more. Now
column14: while I do still have to fight the depression
column15: at least I feel I can. I can actually usually choose my reactions to stress instead of my reactions choosing me
column16: have spent more time out of bed and actually able to function when my PMDD isn't kicking my butt ten days a month around my period (any suggestions for this?)
column17: & have been able to cope MUCH better. BTW
column18: just some of the other drugs I tried (and yes
column19: did give them at least a month or two - didn't have the severe side effects as with the Lexapro
column23: Effexor ... there were more I can't remember off-hand
column24: including ones for anxiety/panic attacks.  It had gotten to where I didn't believe in the meds at all before trying the Lex.  Now I wish I'd hung in there before & kept trying until I found one that worked for me. Could have maybe saved me years of grief and a messed-up life. Anyway
column25: REALLY grateful for this drug! Hang in there all & keep trying!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$4$My Gynecologist prescribed Lexapro for my Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD) and I had wonderful results using it; however

column4: my severe mood swings and anxiety had all but vanished

column7: and then the shocks or the buzz. I had moments of staring and not being able to break my gaze. I was lucky I didn't throw them away. I started taking them again and all the withdrawal episodes went away. I had to have medical guidance from my Internal Medicine Doctor to get off the med. After all that
column8: I still think using the Lexapro was worth it
column9: because it did help me. I just couldn't live with the weight gain. I guess I would rather be moody and anxiety ridden then overweight.

column7: but I'm not a drinker so won't be doing that again."

column1: 1735$Condition: Depression$11/5/2009 11:00:49 PM$Reviewer: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$

column1: 1737$Condition: Depression$11/5/2009 3:23:34 AM$Reviewer: Iamawesome
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$5$5$I started taking 20mg Lexapro in May 2009. For the first few weeks there was little positive about the medicine. I was very nauseated and had severe headaches. I talked to my doctor and he told me to keep at it. I did and got over the symptoms within a few weeks. After that I quickly noticed positive changes. However
column3: I have gained over 20lbs and have a very tired feeling throughoit the day. Rarely do I have trouble sleeping. When I do not take my medicine for a few days

column5: dizzy and these zap like pulses through my body that arent necessarily painful but uncomfortable and dissorienting. My Dad passed away a few months after i started taking this medication and that was quite a test. I felt like I was in control of myself and able to still properly grieve.  Overall
column6: I am quite happy with the results thus far and it is important to keep with it and take it as prescribed.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"Lexapro worked best for me.  I would recommend talking to your doctor about taking the lowest dose possible. 10mg & 5mg made me sleepy. 2.5mg worked well so did 1.25mg (cut 5mg pill in 1/4).

column2: noise
column3: moving your eyes
column4: turning your head
column5: etc.) Tapering-off lessens the severity of the 'brain zaps' but they will still occur.  I've been off for approx 1yr and will still get these 'brain zaps' once in a while if its really quiet
column6: dark
column7: and I'm tired.

column1: With my husband deploying I've started to take them again but only 1.25mg
column2: just enough to dull the extreme emotions without making me spacey."

column1: 1805$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$10/11/2009 12:12:01 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I took tricyclics
column2: then Prozac
column3: then Wellbutrin
column4: before starting Lexapro. None of the previous worked as immediately or as well for me as Lexapro. (My advice: DO NOT JUDGE THIS OR ANY MEDICINE BY SIDE EFFECTS IN FIRST FEW DAYS. If I had stopped any of these medicines based on first couple of days
column5: I would never have taken any anti-depressants and life would not be good. Or really
column6: I might not be here anymore.) BACK TO SUBJECT: On Lexapro
column7: my anxiety was improved
column8: as well as my depression. I used 10 mg for about a year
column9: then upped to 20 mg when it seemed necessary. I will say that I have been more sleepy
column10: less energetic and have an increased appetite (translation: I gained 30 lbs. and I am a skinny person). I also have had increased problems with memory and concentration
column11: and have trouble finding words when I am speaking. I am not sure whether the focus/memory is due to the Lexapro or not. But it doesn't help those areas
column12: so I added Wellbutrin to the Lexapro for a time in order to see if focus/appetite/energy could be improved. I may still do that again at some point. My dr. said that using an SSRI for a long time can lead to less dopamine
column13: which you need for concentration
column14: energy and other things. For now
column15: I am switching to a drug that acts on more than one neurotransmitter (norepinephrine and serotinin) just like the combo of Wellbutrin and Lexapro to see if that helps with fatigue
column16: focus and memory. But I would not change a thing about my experience with Lexapro. It was the right drug for me at the time. If you are anxious and depressed
column17: it is an especially good option. Realize that you may have to revisit whether it's the best option from time to time.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$4$"I have been taking Lexapro for almost 3 months; started at 5mg the first 2 weeks and have been on 10 mg since. I love it and it has helped me in so many ways.

1823$Condition: Other$10/5/2009 9:53:49 PM$Reviewer: resse2004, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$This drug is really scary.I took just 10 mg daily for 2 days,the 2nd day was hell.I suffered a horriable panic attack,nausea,racing heart beat,unable 2 move despite trying,And the scariest side effect of all was:ALL OF A SUDDEN OUT OF THE BLUE THE 2ND DAY.I WANTED 2 JUMP OFF A BRIDGE,MY BRAIN WAS TELLING ME 2 GO JUMP OFF A BRIDGE.I know this sounds crazy.But I seriously felt like this the 2nd day of taking Lexapro.I never took it again.Told my Dr. 2 go 2 hell.I would rather stay up all nite with little sleep then 2 commit sucide.I was being treated for insomia.I was not depressed....I do not recommend meds for depression  unless u r so depressed that u don't want 2 live anymore.Please,please if you decide to take a anti depressant,don't feel embrassed to tell some1 if u have thoughts of sucide.It can save your life.I was ashamed 2 tell any1 how I felt.Thank god he gave me the strength 2 overcome the thoughts of sucide on my own& not do actually do what my mind was telling me 2 do.

column3: but it gradually became less frequent & disappeared.  It also makes you a little tired at times if you cut your sleep short.  If I get a good 7-8 hours of sleep each night

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Lexapro has made significant positive impact on my and my family's life. One major benefit that contradicts other reviewers reports are that my monthly migraines have subsided substantially.  I no longer need to take anything for them.  I do sleep much better than before lexapro and sometimes have trouble shaking the cobwebs from my head in the morning.  Sexual side effects are gone
column3: libido is back.  I am grateful for this medication - as my husband is too.  I am back to the person I used to be!

column1: 1923$Condition: Depression$8/25/2009 10:37:36 PM$Reviewer: del295
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $2$3$5$"A lot of these reviews are suspicious so I decided to write one.

column1: I've been taking Lexapro for over 4 years now
column2: I originally started at 10mg
column3: once per day
column4: I shortened my dose to half a pill every other day due to severe anger problems while taking this medication. I can say it definitely helps with depression
column5: however for me it was very ineffective at helping with OCD issues -- I still have my routines
column6: merely in spurts now.

column1: I do not recommend this medication to anyone unless all other medications for lighter symptoms fail. This drug is very powerful and should not be taken simply because you had a bad day at work
column2: etc. I can vouch for anger issues associated with taking this medication daily
column3: as well as bi-polar behavior and loss of mental focus
column4: lack of feeling real/alive mentally & visually
column5: etc.

column1: I've tried kicking this medication and it is not difficult to get off of
column2: very few withdrawals -- however I suggest cutting the dose gradually rather than going cold turkey.

column1: This medication does not seem to conflict with Propranolol.
Side effects I have experienced are dry mouth
column2: constipation
column3: jittery eyes and erection problems but they are tolerable in comparison to depression.

column1: It is also very expensive
column2: at least $90 without insurance.

column1: If you're on this medication
column2: make sure it works for you and you feel it helps
column3: otherwise find one that actually helps you and do not force yourself to adapt mentally to it."

column1: 1939$Condition: Depression$8/20/2009 11:09:31 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$3$"I was prescribed Lexapro to treat my depression
column2: and was only on the drug for one week. During that week
column3: my energy level dropped significantly
column4: I could barely stay awake throughout the day and my brain was in a complete fog. I was spaced out and loopy and felt exhausted. It didn't matter whether I took it in the morning or at night
column5: with our without food
column6: the results were the same. I could barely function through a work day
column7: and I probably shouldn't have been driving a car in this state. I didn't cry or feel depressed during the week
column8: but I can't say that I felt much of anything
column9: except strange. I have been off it for 24 hours now
column10: and the difference is amazing. I have my energy back
column11: I'm not loopy and I'm not physically exhausted. I can focus on work tasks again. My doctor has prescribed Cymbalta as the next drug for me to try for treating the depression
column12: which I have not started yet.

column1: I read many positive reviews about Lexapro
column2: and I guess the point of me writing this review is so that people can see that in some cases
column3: this drug is clearly not for everyone. And if you are immediately experiencing some of the less common side effects
column4: talk to your doctor immediately."

I might have had some sexual side effects and mild weight gain but it's really hard to know whether those were from the drug or the mental condition. column1: 2132$Condition: Depression$6/23/2009 12:07:14 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$3$4$"This drug worked well for treating depression with very few side effects (mild loss of libido)
column2: however
column3: if you EVER have a doctor tell you to quit this cold turkey (or want to do so yourself) - DON'T!!!

column2: and I ended up in the ER with a BP of 190/124 and a horrible crawling sensation all over my body like I had to keep moving and couldn't hold still. I was stuck in the median on the freeway and it was all I could do to drive to the hospital. I threw up all over my car and was sweating profusely.  The only thing that made the symptoms subside was to go back on it.  I had to taper my dose for 2 weeks to get off it.  My Dr. thought I was full of it and didn't believe that I had an adverse reaction to quitting cold turkey. I would strongly advise against that
column3: despite what your Dr. might tell you. "

column3: I started to feel too good and started displaying signs of hypomania (high part of bipolar). This effected every relationship
column4: both personal and professional in my life
column5: but I didn't care at the time and I stayed on the medication. After I realized that Lexapro had uncovered a hidden hypomania activity

column1: 2224$Condition: Depression$5/25/2009 1:58:19 PM$Reviewer: myoska
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$"I suffer from mild depression.  I don't contemplate suicide but am depressed a lot
column3: seemingly without reason.  Seven months ago my doctor prescribed

column1: Lexapro so I tried the 10mg dose.  It took a week or two to feel a change but it definitely works for me.  My wife tells me I'm a lot easier to live with and frankly I feel more comfortable most of the time.  I'm certainly much less depressed than before.  I recommend it for those that reap its benefits.  Like any drug
column2: it's probably not for everyone.  However there are some negative considerations as well.  It's harder to wake up in the morning.  I take naps when I can.  Sometimes I fall asleep reading a book
column3: where I never used to.  Sexual desire is down but not gone.  I don't feel it has inhibited an erection but sometimes reaching orgasm can be difficult.  I guess that's why they make Viagra.  Another thing to consider is
column4: don't miss a dose.  I failed to take it one morning and noticed I was a bit more grouchy than usual that day.  I took it the following day and was so spaced out at work that I hope I never forget to take it again.  I was forgetting people's names I had known for a while.  Familiar things were unfamiliar.  It was scary.  The following days were fine as long as I stay on the drug.  I've heard it was hard discontinuing usage of Lexapro now I believe it.  The positives definitely outweigh the negatives for me."

I no longer suffer form crippling depression or the manic mood swings that would keep me from sleeping for days on end. What used to be a slingshot rollercoaster ride of emotion has become a leisurely drive through the country. For the most part I average 8 hours of sleep a night now instead of 10-12. I can also get to sleep very easily compared to the nights of laying awake for 3-4 hours because my mind wouldn't shut off. I haven't noticed any side affects. I am an artist and haven't noted any lack of creativity or ""passion"" for my work. In fact quite the opposite. Now that I am for the most part in control of myself
column2: I can tap into that creativity and passion whenever I want. No weight gain
column3: lose or increase of appetite
column4: loss of sex drive
column5: or even any nausea. I control my emotions now
column6: not the other way around. I have just recently moved back to the city where I went to college 10 years ago and reconnected with some old friends who noticed immediately the change in my demeanor and composure

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been on Lexapro for a year and have been very pleased with the results.  Take it for depression/anxiety combo.  Started out on Lorazepam for anxiety attacks
column3: but quickly realized I needed a daily medication.  Had used Xanax for a short period a few years ago
column4: but I like the Lexapro because it isn't habit forming (I'm sure there are withdrawal symptoms
column5: but it isn't addictive).  Started at 10mg
column6: which worked fine until I was laid-off earlier this year
column7: so I switched to 20mg.  Doing fine on 20mg and plan to stay.  Lexapro has made a huge difference in my life - I used to have trouble sleeping
column8: was disinterested in life in general
column9: often wondered what the point of living was
column10: and would constantly worry about EVERYTHING.  I felt improvement of my depression within 1 week of receiving the prescription.  A word on side effects:  I too felt EXTREME fatigue
column11: nausea
column12: terrible headaches
column13: and lack of appetite in the first couple of days.  I was taking it in the morning before going to work and I honestly felt AWFUL within an hour of taking it - but the depression was getting better so I hung in there with the medication
column14: figuring the side effects would go away once my body adjusted to the medication.  I also switched to taking the medication at night right before I went to bed instead of in the morning
column15: so any side effects would occur while I was sleeping and I didn't feel them as much.  Thankfully making that switch did the trick and as far as I know the side effect went away after the first week or so.  Give it time if you're just starting or thinking about starting.

column1: 2363$Condition: Depression$4/11/2009 9:27:59 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was diagnosed with Depression/General Anxiety Disorder. I was having panic attacks and couldn't finish a thought yet would lay awake at night and stress all day about anything and everything. I was prescribed 10 mg at first and took that for about a month. After having another awful panic attack in my sleep I asked the doctor to up the dosage. Now I have been taking 20mg for over 2 years and it does wonders for me. I am more even-tempered and don't have the anxiety/panic attacks. Sometimes I still struggle with stressing about things but not like I did before. I can finish a thought and think clearly. It has improved my memory (I have a really bad memory-some short term and long term)and I am able to function much better daily. I did have sexual side effects for a long while but after so long those seemed to dissolve as well. I wish I could tell everyone who needs help about this and how it has helped me. There's nothing more relieving than to be able to function everyday on a normal basis. I would recomment atleast trying this medication.

column10: lack of balance and exhaustion.  I recommend to everyone to truly investigate teh side effects of this medication BEFORE you start taking it.  It is now six weeks later and most of the symptoms have subsided except an occassional dizzy spell.  Please talk to your doctor about teh side effects of this medication adn teh withdrawal sympoms which can last anywhere from 2 days to 3 months."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was on Lexapro about a year ago

column5: and right now (after several others) I am on Celexa-a similar version of Lexapro-but not close enough.  I was also on Topamax with the Lexapro

column1: 2396$Condition: Depression$3/27/2009 3:03:07 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$1$5$I was put on this medicine for Depression

column4: I have noticed that I have begun having Suicidal thoughts which is not like me. I am on 20mg and my OB/GYN put me on Xanax after about 5 months to help with the severe anger issues that were still coming up. Taking this medication scared me and made me feel like there was something seriously wrong with me. I also noticed that my Depression got alot worse and I didn't know how to deal with it. I was just taken off the medication by a psychologist and I am on something that I am praying will help me since I don't feel like anything else will.  Be very careful when you are taking this medication and don't wait as long as I did to tell your doctor if your problems get worse or if new ones pop up.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"I've been taking this medicine for about five months to treat anxiety.  My chronic anxiety had started to manifest itself into irratibility.  This medicine has make a tremendous difference in my life.  My first two weeks on the medication I experienced side effects where I felt ""foggy"" headed
column3: sleepy and I yawned a lot.  I also felt very relaxed and unconcerned which was a relief.  After that I started to wonder if the effects of the drug had worn off.  What I didn't realize is that I had stop ""blowing up"" at my family at the end of the day.  My level of anxiety and subsequent irratibility is the lowest it has been in many years.  The only side effect I experience now is a slightly reduced interest in sex.  For me
column4: the benefits far outweigh this negative.  In my case
column5: interest and performance are inter related.  I am 46 yo MWM.  My ability to perform is not diminished by the medicine
column6: but my interest is.  However

2399$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$3/26/2009 8:26:36 PM$Reviewer: L.J., 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was having terrible panic attacks! I could not even drive. When my Dr. gave me samples of this medication, I rolled my eyes? I thought I needed to be checked into the hospital for a million dollor work up on my brain? The first 3-4 days I still hade attacks. There were cirtain places I had to avoid,Stop lights,the bank,my kids school parking lot? Then the 5 day it was like turning a off a light swith. I have been on this medication for 4 years, I will never go without it. I started on 20mg of Celexa, when I changed to Lexapro I was given 10mg. I have never had to increase my dose! I take one every AM, I never forget it. You need to realize it takes a week for this medication to get into your system. Also, Lexapro works on BOTH sides of your brain, Celexa only on side at a time. I am so thankful for this medication, I have my life back!!! If it makes you sleepy,take it at nite. If it keeps you up,take it in the am. It is worth you time to really give this medication time to balance your panic attacks and anxiety. Work with your Dr. Best Wishes, God Bless!

I gained this much weight in a matter of just seven months.  I finally requested to go off this medicine and have been off it now for two weeks with no weight loss yet. column1: 2418$Condition: Other$3/19/2009 10:59:20 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$4$5$"I had a ""trifecta"" of issues when I was put on this family of antidepressants eleven years ago.  Post Traumatic Stress Disorder

column1: 2520$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$2/19/2009 3:48:38 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$
2521$Condition: Depression$2/19/2009 1:56:35 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $2$1$1$"DISCONTINUING LEXAPRO IS HELL.
Most doctors do not warn patients about SSRI DISCONTINUATION SYNDROME
column2: so please research this before deciding that Lexapro is right for you.

column1: Lexapro was fairly effective at easing my depression
column2: but every time I missed a dose
column3: I felt sick.  Because of this
column4: and the sexual side effects (complete inability to orgasm
column5: no arousal during sex
column6: no interest in sex)
column7: I decided to switch to Wellbutrin
column8: and let me tell you
column9: DISCONTINUING LEXAPRO IS HELL.  PLEASE
column10: please before taking Lexapro
column11: look up SSRI Discontinuation Syndrome on Wikipedia. It has been over a month since I finally tapered off Lexapro
column12: and I have felt sick the whole time.  It's like having the flu every day but it doesn't go away
column13: and the feeling of being ""zapped"" every few minutes is VERY disconcerting.  I am only JUST starting to feel better
column14: however I still get major headaches every day
column15: I feel like I have a low-grade fever and my body still hurts most of the time.

column1: If you do take Lexapro
column2: DO NOT QUIT COLD TURKEY. TAPER OFF VERY SLOWLY to lessen the very unpleasant effects of discontinuing it.  My doctor had me taking 50mg/day
column3: which sounds like a lot
column4: but it took that much to be effective for me. But nobody warned me that I would have to take it the rest of my life or suffer the misery of discontinuing it.

column1: Lexapro can be a very effective medication
column2: and the benefits of taking it can outweigh the problems it may cause
column3: so do the research and make an educated decision based upon your personal needs.

column1: Keep in mind that WebMD is sponsored by pharmaceutical companies
column2: so you probably won't find anything about SSRI Discontinuation Syndrome here unless you are reading what patients have submitted.

column1: Please research carefully and thoroughly so that you understand exactly what you are getting into if you do decide to take Lexapro.  "

column3: I was on too high a dose of each individually
column4: and almost gave up. Luckily

column8: and increase energy. Worst side effect of Lexapro didn't turn up for two years...night sweats. They're horrible

Weird that the side effect listings don't describe that problem. It should be easier to report side effects to the government. The FDA website makes the process next to impossible unless someone has died as a result of the drug. Overall
column10: Lexapro is worth trying for its milder side effects
column11: but no generic is available just yet.

column1: 2631$Condition: Panic Disorder$1/16/2009 11:09:52 AM$Reviewer: GetWell
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$Had repeated periods of intense nervousness
column3: anxiety and lightheadedness to the point of nearly fainting
column4: and a lot of trouble sleeping at night
column5: which I attributed to stress and/or too much caffiene.  Then I had my first panic attack.  I was sure I was going insane.  Dr. put me on Lexapro 20mg per day and Klonopin as needed if I felt an attack coming on.  The Klonopin also helped ease the transition onto the Lexapro.  I was able to stop taking the Klonopin after a couple of weeks when the Lexapro was fully effective.  In the time since the Dr. has bumped my Lexapro dose up to 30mg per day.  After nearly 2 years I have not had a single panic attack and my anxiety issues are gone.  I feel normal again.  I only take a Klonopin if I am going into a situation that I know will cause stress (like flying)
column6: and that is only a couple of times per year.  The rest of the time I am doing fine on the Lexapro
column7: sleeping well
column8: not worrying all the time
column9: sweating less
column10: etc.  I don't care if I have to stay on this for the rest of my life
column11: I feel normal and happy again
column12: and that's worth it. I take it at night just before bed because it does make me sleepy. This drug is not for everyone
column13: so don't give up if it doesn't work well for you
column14: try Effexor or Welbutrin.  You don't have to live with panic or anxiety
column15: it is caused by a chemical issue that CAN be treated with the right drugs.  Best of luck to you
column16: and get yourself well!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$4$"To the poster below seeking withdrawal advice:

column1: I took Lexapro for 11 years after the death of my son and husband.  Got tired of taking it and AMA
column2: I weaned myself off it a little tiny bit at a time.  I actually shaved down the tablet over 4 months until there was nothing left.  Side effects were ""brain freeze""
column3: delayed vision
column4: nausea
column5: headache
column6: feeling like I was falling backwards
column7: and other minor ones.  I put my friends and employer on notice and they helped out a lot.  If you decide to withdraw
column8: do it very
column9: very slowly and watch for the side effects.  They disappear over time.  I've been off 2 years now and I'm fine.  I cry but I prefer that to not feeling anything. On the other hand
column10: Lexapro helped me get through the roughest thing I'll ever experience.  I could not have done it without help and Lexapro stabilized me enough that outside professional help was possible."

column1: 2752$Condition: Depression$12/6/2008 11:34:10 AM$Reviewer: a concerned patient
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$After the first day of taking this medication
column3: I was unable to sleep more than 4 hours that night and had virtually no appetite.  This continued until the 3rd day when I experienced extreme palpitations and fast heart rate with some pinching and tight  feelings in the left chest area.  At that point I stopped taking the medication but was unable to return to the prescribing doctor due to financial concerns.  I am still concerned this drug may have damaged my heart in some way
column4: or precipitated a heart condition I have never had before.  Also
column5: after discontinuing this drug I was completely exhausted and weak for several days.  Maybe my experience with this drug is uncommon
column6: but I still believe this drug is too dangerous to be on the market.  I would not recommend it to anyone!!!  (It should be noted that all my tests the prior year were negative including complete lab work and a nuclear stress test.  I am 54 years old with no known prior medical conditions.)

column1: 2754$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$12/5/2008 8:25:03 PM$Reviewer: godfollowers
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$4$"When I first started taking Lexapro (anxiety) it made me really sick to my stomach. I would feel very lightheaded. I was taking it in the morning though. I switched to nighttime and after about a week or two the side effects went away. So to anyone out there experiencing side effects give the medication a try for about two weeks. I was on 10mg at first and I did notice a difference. I wasn't so high strung
column3: was able to focus so much better
column4: and was able to deal with life in general much better. This only lasted for a couple of weeks and then I was back where I started. I went back to the doctor and he doubled the dosage to 20mg. I must say I've been taking it now for about a year and half and it is WONDERFUL for me! I am able to handle situations that I never would have been able to handle before. It also helps me with my ""monthly"" bouts of depression. If you're a female you know what I mean. I've got to be honest this has been a wonder drug for me. I realize that medication effects people differently and what's good for one person may not be good for another. But
column5: if offered Lexapro by your physician
column6: give it a chance. As with most other drugs you will probably experience some sort of side effects the first week or two. Thanks for letting me share and hopefully this review will be able to help someone."

column1: 2785$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$11/28/2008 12:54:47 AM$Reviewer: Sonia
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was a 23 year old when I first started taking Lexapro for anxiety. Prior to starting the med
column3: I was very stressed and close to depression. The main symptom I was experiencing was extreme muscle pain in my neck and shoulders along with tension headaches that would make me nauseous. I would also sometimes have panic-like symptoms
column4: such as fast heart rate and sweating in some circumstances. Taking Lexapro was like NIGHT AND DAY. It made me feel less irritable
column5: calm
column6: and care-free without that ""flat affect"" feel of some other meds. Most of all
column7: it reduced my muscle pain dramatically. The heavy cost of the med is completely worth it. Substitutions like Celexa (Citalopram) have side effects like weight gain and are not as effective. Lexapro is a great option for those that are physically stressed and need a pill to feel normal again. I stopped taking Lexapro when I felt ready (approx. 2 years later) and do not feel dependent at all. Make sure you  follow doctor's orders and wean yourself off it slowly. "

column3: my short term memory was completely gone and my appetite was out of control. I gained about 21 pounds on it in about 4 months which is very disappointing. I quit taking it because my anxiety levels just were not chaning at all. I would not recommend quitting cold turkey because the withdrawl is not fun. Extreme dizziness and moments where I feel like I have absolutely no idea where I am or what I'm doing there- it's literally like stepping into yourself after leaving your body for a few moments. My skin has also broken out severly
column4: I don't think I've had this many blemishes on my face at one time in my entire life. It was easy to use in terms of convenience because I just took it once a day and didn't have to worry about taking it twice a day or every 6 house or something like that.

column1: 3042$Condition: Depression$9/10/2008 4:29:02 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$3$"I have been taking Lexapro for about 5 weeks.  Overall
column2: I would say that it has definitely helped me with depression.

column1: The main reason I am writing this is that I experienced strong anxiety
column2: bordering on panic attacks
column3: for the first couple of days that I was taking the drug.  My doctor was skeptical that this was possible so quickly - one of the main reasons he prescribed Lexapro specifically was due to the relatively low incidence of major side effects.

column1: I just want to make sure that anyone else who experiences a similar reaction initially knows that it is not just them.  The major anxiety went away for me after a couple of days.  I have had some degree of a lot of the side effects listed (dry mouth
column2: stomach issues
column3: some decrease in sex drive
column4: etc.) but they have dissipated over time.

column1: With Lexapro
column2: counseling
column3: and some changes that I made in my life
column4: I have been able to go from being pretty depressed most of the time (to the degree of having borderline suicidal thoughts) to feeling fairly close to normal.

column1: So just some encouragement that though some people may have more difficulty getting started on the drug than they are led to expect
column2: it has been worth it in my experience."

column3: relaxed not drug induced just like you would feel when you weren't stressed.  Most people with GAD doesn't know what that feels like.  I had VIVID dreams yelling out but asleep
column4: trying to get away from someone and kicking my husband (hee hee) It was all funny in the end.  This stopped and the tiredness began.  I was EXHAUSTED all the time could sleep 24/7.  We ran every blood work we could think of and finally came to the Lexapro.  I was taking 20mg then cut it to 10mg and slowly quit taking it.  The Fatigue went away.  I was so unhappy because I knew I would have to switch and loved Lexapro.  But if I can't get out of bed to care for my children there isn't much benefit.  I have been switched to Cymbalta.  I hope it is Lexapro without the severe fatigue.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$"I was on both wellbutrin and Lexapro to stop smoking and was to stay on wellbutrin only a few months. I didn't realize over time that I'd become less able to think clearly or calmly.  I was shaking
column3: trembling at times.  Bursts of anger and panic attacks
column4: mad at the world and going over and over bad things that happened and really everything got to me.  I just last week returned to using the Lexapro.  Starting on 10 mg and this doctor said to go to 20 mgs.  At first I was dizzy and sort of sleepy
column5: but I also was calmer and got things done.  I was having trouble leaving the house.  Now I get ready and go!  I can concentrate better and I'm getting so much more accomplished.  I sleep better and feel like I'm in a good mood
column6: actually a little perky and much more outgoing.  I was on lexapro for about a year before the wellbutrin was introduced and it really helped in quitting smoking
column7: but I now see I should have stopped the wellbutrin and stayed on my Lexapro.  It's expensive on my RX plan $50 a month but I feel convinced it is well worth it.  If anyone know when the generic will come out
column8: let me know!!!!!  Thank you for listening!"

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$3$"Neither my psychiatrist nor psychologist can tell me what diagnosis i have exactly. But

column4: born with it) depression and anxiety. So they said: ""Go with Lexapro"". I have been on it for a little more than a month now. I think it's working. My anxiety has subsided. I used to have these feelings of loneliness
column5: despair quite often and easily triggered. I still get anxious and lonely but not as frequently and i do not  start feeling as hopeless. The first week on this pill i could not sleep
column6: now i can barely get out of bed in the morning. But it is a kind of nice sleepy feeling

column9: i swear
column10: it does not bother me as much
column11: i kind of look at it more calmly
column12: without panicking and running to change the shirt. Funny. So

column8: I experienced an electric shock sensation in my brain approx. every 30 seconds
column9: and my temper was through the roof!  So

column11: I came off of Lexapro with just the electric brain shock sensation (that never seemed to really go away) and after finding Wellbuitrin SR and XL ineffective
column12: requested to add back 2.5mg of Lexapro and I'm back to feeling pretty good again.  Not as great as 5 mg

column1: 3324$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$4/23/2008 11:47:59 PM$Reviewer: Michael
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$"I developed panic attacks from accumulated job stress 2 years ago.  I was absolutely resistent to drug treatment
column3: tryting months of alternative therapies.  After virtually no relief I finally ""caved"" and began Lexapro as part of a multi-pronged aspproach that seems to be working: I requested a role change at my job
column4: committed to getting more sleep & eating better
column5: started seeing a therapist
column6: and began Lexapro @ 10mg.  It took 6 weeks for the med to work - the panic was less frequent and less intense but still needed xanax on occasion.  After 3 months
column7: upped dose to 20mg and I am thankful at how I am WAY better than a year ago.  One noticeable side effect - I've gained 12 lbs in the last 2-3 months (hadn't gained weight in many years before)
column8: my Dr. told me virtually unavoidable with this class of meds.  I look at it as a necessary evil - I am functioning consistently almost like my old self again.  The weight gain is frustrating and I would think I'll lose it when I can wean off the drug
column9: but it does work for me and is giving me hope to restore balance to my life again..."

column1: My Dr took me off the patch

column3: increased my dosage to 20mg/day...

column1: Lexapro has helped me a great deal... I am back to work
column2: with a better attitude
column3: no thoughts of suicide
column4: all is going well again.

column1: If I forget to take my meds before I go to bed (once in a while)
column2: I definitely can feel it. Or if I forget to call in my perscription and I'm off of the meds for a couple of days
column3: I start getting the chest pains
column4: become very agitated
column5: irritable
column6: and I begin to feel depressed again. So I do recommend Lexapro
column7: and I do recommend that you don't forget to fill your perscription. If it helps you and you see and feel that it has improved you... and made you feel better than what you were feeling before you started taking it... keep taking Lexapro as a maintenance. It really does work.

column1: 3381$Condition: Depression$3/28/2008 10:33:50 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$3$4$Was on it for 3+ years and decided with my doc to change meds because my sex drive was NONEXISTENT and other meds had become available that had fewer sexual side effects - We weaned me down VERY slowly - Literally over a month's time or more - Did the last .25mg for 2 weeks and then stopped - Felt weird at first and then exactly 10-14 days after my last dose I crashed - We had had a snowstorm the night before and all the dr.'s offices in town were closed - I wasn't suicidal
column2: per se
column3: but I definitely had a concious understanding of how people can be - Scared me very badly and I went to the emergency room immediately - The psych on call ended up working for the same place where I went for therapy sessions so I started seeing him and everything went very well after that - So my primary opinion is that you should be VERY VERY careful when you are going off of it

column1: 3389$Condition: Posttraumatic Stress Syndrome$3/24/2008 10:04:06 PM$Reviewer: Jennyrose44
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"This drug has changed my life. I have been on 5 mg/day for 4 years to treat anxiety disorder. I had panic attacks since age 3
column3: then anxiety disorder since 14. I had been entirely resistant to taking medication to treat my anxiety
column4: but after being diagnosed with PTSS (after a near-fatal car accident in my family) my doctor said I really should give this new drug a try. It doesn't take away the consciousness of being anxious or worried for me
column5: but does take away the physical symptoms of anxiety and allows me to deal with it so much better. I went from being afraid of leaving my house to moving alone to Scotland and traveling the U.S. for work. I suggest this drug as an option for anyone struggling with consistent anxiety (not just ""being stressed""). It's not for everyone
column6: and I would suggest starting with a low dose first to see how that does
column7: especially if you're as resistant to going on drug treatment as I was."

column1: 3390$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$3/24/2008 7:43:45 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$I started Lexapro after severe side effects taking Zoloft (which was odd since I had successfully been on Zoloft for 16 months 3 years prior). For Lexapro

column4: tongue

column6: arms

column8: as well as increased overall anxiety and panic attacks that were worse than the original anxiety. It has been 5 weeks since I stopped Lexapro
column9: and I now take half a .25 mg Xanax every 2-3 days as needed(at first it was every day). I also have been exercising at least 3 times a week. My anxiety is almost gone now. This regimen is working out much better for me than the SSRIs for now.

I'm doing as my sister did when she got off of it and will never take anything ever again.  I feel like a drugie needing a fix. I say to anyone that reads this DO NOT START TAKING THIS MEDICATION!"

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$"Age 45

Overall I am doing much better considering I was in the hospital 3 weeks ago and am now at home (though going to group therapy daily on short term disability).  One bad side effect of Lexapro for me (being a male) is sexual dysfunction.  But
column8: from what I read online
column9: that is a ""common and known"" issue.  To describe the problem in ""kind words""... let's just say the bomber can take off and fly the mission
column10: but can't deliver the payload.  I know that may still be too graphic for some
column11: but I tried to be polite about it.  I hope the doctor slowly tapers my dosage back and that issue gradually goes away.  But
column12: for now

column14: WE ARE ALL GOOD PEOPLE.  We will get better in time.  Take care!"

I told my doctor I wasn't sleeping well and was somewhat unhappy with what happened to me time after having 2 kids close together.  It is called life....I should of listened to my instinct and waited to get more me time than letting my dr. put me on meds.  I specifically said I didn't want to gain weight and I enjoyed my sex life and didn't want any interference.  Unfortunately
column3: I let him talk me into it and continued with it til now.  I have since gained at least 20 lbs. and have a harder time orgasming. The weight gain has not helped my self confidence either.  I started weening myself off the meds slowly and will try to deal with the side effects - dizziness
column4: nausea
column5: memory issues both on and getting off meds.  I have since been able to join a gym which my kids also enjoy going to.  That is how I used to be - very active.  I just had to be patient until my kids were a little older to allow more time for me.  Again
column6: I should of listened to my instinct
column7: not cover up everyday issues of a new mom with medication.  Some people need extra help with all kinds of issues.  I just think my doctor was quick with prescribing without understanding my background.  Too quick to line the pockets of drug companies.  There are way too many people on meds that might really not need it.  I am not discounting some real mental issues that need meds.  I used to work with a psychiatrist and do believe many do need meds.  I just would recommend investigating the meds and getting a couple of opinions if possible.  I just cannot wait to get off this med.  Good luck to those of you on it.

I see everything differently now than I used when I was depressed. But....there are some side effects that I connect with the drug. I always feel very tired and I can sleep up to 15 hours a day
column3: which is not really helping my relationship with my boyfriend and my lifestyle. I still have some anxiety epizodes and experience a shortness of breath. Occasionaly I take Atarax for my panic attacks... But considering what this med has done for me these things are pretty minor.

column1: 3689$Condition: Depression$12/21/2007 1:55:33 AM$Reviewer: sakura_aoki
column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$2$3$Well it does it's job very very well but I had a very strange side effect that only my mother and I (as she was also on it) had. I slept about 20 hours straight about once a week or I slept 14 hours every night. This also occured when my dose was moved up from 20 mL to 40mL.I was
column3: before it
column4: a self harmer. Probably once every other day
column5: about a month after I was able to stop completely though this doesn't always happen. It sometimes made my head spin a little and I was often dizzy
column6: though that is possibly just me. The other thing is I had severe withdrawal reactions. To be honest i felt like i had an axe in my head. My best advice with that is don't drive
column7: don't take any of your thoughts seriously
column8: and likely if you call a pharmacy they will give you two if you can't get through the weekend (i discovered this and it was a lifesaver). Most people apparently do not have this problem. It also works very very well along with concerta. It is a very good drug for what it does just doesn't match up with my body chemistry.  I suggest it and if you can't afford it's price Celexa works as well it just is missing an anti-anxiety affect.

3804$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$11/25/2007 10:59:54 AM$Reviewer: Widowed by Lexapro
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $1$1$1$"THIS MEDICATION KILLED MY HUSBAND. Normally optimistic
column3: after suffering a bout of insomnia - he became withdrawn and zombie-like. He hid despairing thoughts
column4: and wrote a suicide note 5 days after taking this drug. Three weeks later he killed himself at the age of 58. He had everything to live for and was the last personality type who would commit suicide. This drug can be a killer for certain individuals
column5: especially if they are do not fall into a typical depressed category. His doctor gave him samples ""to help him sleep"". DO NOT LET ANYONE YOU KNOW TAKE THIS DRUG WITHOUT THE CLOSE ATTENTION OF A PSYCHIATRIST. OFTEN PEOPLE
column6: PARTICULARLY MEN
column7: WILL LIE OR HIDE SUICIDAL IMPULSES EVEN WHEN ASKED DIRECTLY (AS I DID). I watched my husband for any signs of suicidal ideation
column8: and there were none. He hid it all. I disliked the zombie quality he was exhitibiting
column9: but I knew that the medicine claims to need weeks to begin to work. THE FACT IS THIS MEDICINE CAN TAKE ONLY 3-5 DAYS TO TURN THE BRAIN CHEMISTRY AROUND TO SUICIDE....My advice: Don't let anyone you know take this drug - there are so many other antidepressants out there with less risk. Lexapro is being pushed as ""safe"" but hundreds of people have committed suicide out of the blue on it. History will record Lexapro as being one of the worst offenders in pandering this drug as safe
column10: when it is clearly not. Sample packages are still being given out casually all over the country. BEWARE THIS DRUG."

column1: 3805$Condition: Depression$11/25/2007 12:37:36 AM$Reviewer: schwaermerei

column3: OCD
column4: personality disorder. Lexapro 15 mg per day. (Previously on Celexa.) Lexapro has lost a lot of efficacy with time. Weight gain
column5: despite claims this is not an issue. Effectiveness as an anti-anxiety agent variable (I also take Xanax). Muscle pain has become a problem. Diminished libido from the start. Some blunting of affect. A big advantage for me
column6: though
column7: is that I am sensitive to meds
column8: and Lexapro is one of the best-tolerated of the SSRIs. I'm hopeful that supplementation with another med
column9: and/or tweaking the dose
column10: will restore the beneficial effects for me.

column1: 3899$Condition: Depression$11/4/2007 9:07:36 PM$Reviewer: don't suggest
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$5$The doctors don't tell you this
column3: or maybe most of them don't know.  I took Lexapro for a couple of years to deal with depression from a stressful job/condescending boss.  It did work
column4: but when I stopped taking it I started getting brain jolts
column5: zaps in my mouth
column6: dizziness
column7: vertigo type feeling when I would move my eyeballs
column8: spinning when I would move my eyeballs
column9: and I also had headaches.  It is very hard to explain the symptoms
column10: but you know it when you are dealing with it.  I was absolutely miserable.  I didn't know what it was from and ended up at many doctor's offices thinking I had a brain tumor
column11: multiple sclerosis
column12: you name it.  They gave me an MRI of my brain
column13: lots of tests
column14: you name it.  Finally I did some of my own research on the internet and found that there a LOTS of other people that were going through the same thing.  I just had to type in the right thing in google and there it was.  There were so many people with the same problem
column15: not only from Lexapro but other anti-depressants as well.  You would think doctors would know!These horrible things finally went away after about 6 months of torture.  I don't wish what I went through upon anybody.  I guess if you are never planning on getting off the meds then you are ok
column16: but if it's just a temporary thing then I would recondisder.  The withdrawl symptoms are just too much.  I was also suicidal during the withdrawl.  It is out of my system now and I am clean of anything and feel much better.  If only one person reads this and listens to me it will be worth it to save them from something like this.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$5$"Beware! Doctors will tell you that you can come off of this med whenever you want
column3: but they don't tell you about the hell of withdrawal effects that you'll have to suffer through in order to do so. I have been off of it for a month now and I'm going through exhausting ""electrical shock-like"" episodes almost nonstop. It's like being crually tortured! Along with the shocks
column4: I have headaches
column5: anxiety
column6: and ""brain farts"". If you just want to go on something short term to get through whatever you're going through
column7: I don't recommend this drug. It works very well and I had very few side effects
column8: but plan on staying on it unless you want to see how tuff you really are! If you are a woman and think you might want to get pregnant within the next couple of years
column9: think twice about going on this med or any other like it...doctors recommend coming off of them before conceiving. Look at all of your options
column10: weigh out the good and the bad of each option before making a decision. Just do your research before going on any medication because the doctors won't tell you about how hard it is to come off of them. Good luck!"

column1: 3989$Condition: Depression$10/26/2007 12:35:55 AM$Reviewer: ChubbyCherubp
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I feel it has helped me and I have been on it for over 2 years almost.  I had been on many other anti-depressants and this is the one that has helped my depression the most.  I am on 30 mg as of just a few days ago.  I was on 20 mg.  I have had no side effects with the medication.  And they are easy to take and do what they are supposed to do.  I was put on them originally by a Psychiatrist and also recommended by my own personl Physician (Internist) who I have 100% trust and faith in.  I can't say the same for the Psyhiatrist as he only saw me for 5 minute intervals and I was out the door.  My own personal Internist can do the same prescribing and spends a lot more time with me.  I will soon be seeing a new Psychiatrist as my Doctor feels I may need a mood stabilizer.  So I don't know with that being thrown into the mix (depending on what the Psychiatrist puts me on) how it will mix with the Lexapro.  My Doctor feels I may be Bi-polar and need a certain medication like Lithium.  But that is up to the Psychiatrist.  When I was on Cymbalta 30 mg I was fine but when the original Psychiatrist prescribed the 60 mg I broke out in hives and a rash all over my body.  My lower lip swelled up and my face some.  I was in agony with that rash off and on for months.  So anyone on Cymbalta beware as this is what happened to me.  I never had one bad side effect from Lexapro.  I know a lot of others on it and they haven't either.  Lexapro is my anti-depressant choice.  And believe me I have been on at least 10 different ones.  Thank you.  Diane L. Christopher [email protected]
